thread.title: They find a possible habitat for life on Mars
thread.title_full: They find a possible habitat for life on Mars

author: admin_l6ma5gus
title: They find a possible habitat for life on Mars
text:
Ice mixed with dust in the planet’s mid-latitudes could protect subsurface organisms from deadly ultraviolet radiation, but at the same time allow enough light to pass through for photosynthesis. On the left, an image from NASA’s Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter of several ravines in the Terra Sirenum region of Mars. The right, a ravine in the Martian region of Dao Vallis. The white areas at the edge of the gullies are thought to be areas of dusty ice similar to those modeled in the study NASA/JPL-Caltech/University of Arizona
An international team of researchers has just published a model according to which the ice accumulated in the mid-latitudes of Mars could allow the development of life . According to the study, recently published in ‘Communications Earth & Environment’, the thickness and…
